title: Glasgow Coma Scale
description: Standardized scale for assessing level of consciousness based on eye, verbal, and motor responses.

options.label: Spontaneous
options.description: Eyes open spontaneously

options.label: To speech
options.description: Eyes open to verbal command

options.label: To pain
options.description: Eyes open to painful stimulus

options.label: None
options.description: No eye opening

options.label: Oriented
options.description: Oriented and converses

options.label: Confused
options.description: Disoriented and converses

options.label: Inappropriate words
options.description: Inappropriate words, no sustained conversation

options.label: Incomprehensible sounds
options.description: Moaning, no words

options.label: None
options.description: No verbal response

options.label: Obeys commands
options.description: Obeys commands for movement

options.label: Localizes pain
options.description: Purposeful movement toward painful stimulus

options.label: Withdrawal
options.description: Withdraws from painful stimulus

options.label: Abnormal flexion
options.description: Decorticate posturing to painful stimulus

options.label: Extension
options.description: Decerebrate posturing to painful stimulus

options.label: None
options.description: No motor response

interpretation.label: Severe brain injury
interpretation.action: Consider intubation for airway protection; neurosurgical consultation

interpretation.label: Moderate brain injury
interpretation.action: Close monitoring; serial neurological assessments

interpretation.label: Mild brain injury
interpretation.action: Monitor; assess for deterioration

citation: Teasdale G, Jennett B. Assessment of coma and impaired consciousness: a practical scale. Lancet. 1974;2(7872):81-84.

title: Modified Rankin Scale
description: Global outcome scale measuring degree of disability or dependence in daily activities after stroke or neurological disability.

options.label: 0 - No symptoms
options.description: No symptoms at all

options.label: 1 - No significant disability
options.description: No significant disability despite symptoms; able to carry out all usual duties and activities

options.label: 2 - Slight disability
options.description: Unable to carry out all previous activities but able to look after own affairs without assistance

options.label: 3 - Moderate disability
options.description: Requiring some help, but able to walk without assistance

options.label: 4 - Moderately severe disability
options.description: Unable to walk and attend to bodily needs without assistance

options.label: 5 - Severe disability
options.description: Bedridden, incontinent, requiring constant nursing care and attention

options.label: 6 - Dead
options.description: Dead

interpretation.label: No significant disability
interpretation.action: Routine follow-up; secondary stroke prevention

interpretation.label: Slight disability
interpretation.action: Secondary prevention; consider rehabilitation referral

interpretation.label: Moderate disability
interpretation.action: Rehabilitation services; home health assessment

interpretation.label: Moderately severe disability
interpretation.action: Comprehensive rehabilitation; evaluate for skilled nursing facility

interpretation.label: Severe disability
interpretation.action: Long-term care planning; goals of care discussion

citation: van Swieten JC, Koudstaal PJ, et al. Interobserver agreement for the assessment of handicap in stroke patients. Stroke. 1988;19(5):604-607.

title: ABCD2 Score for TIA
description: Risk stratification tool predicting short-term stroke risk after transient ischemic attack.

options.label: BP < 140/90 mmHg
options.description: Initial blood pressure below 140/90

options.label: BP >= 140/90 mmHg
options.description: Initial blood pressure 140/90 or higher

options.label: Other symptoms
options.description: Symptoms other than weakness or speech disturbance

options.label: Speech disturbance without weakness
options.description: Speech disturbance without unilateral weakness

options.label: Unilateral weakness
options.description: Unilateral weakness with or without speech disturbance

options.label: < 10 minutes
options.description: Symptoms lasted less than 10 minutes

options.label: 10-59 minutes
options.description: Symptoms lasted 10 to 59 minutes

options.label: >= 60 minutes
options.description: Symptoms lasted 60 minutes or more

options.label: Diabetes present
options.description: History of diabetes mellitus

interpretation.label: Low risk
interpretation.action: 2-day stroke risk ~1%; outpatient workup may be appropriate with close follow-up

interpretation.label: Moderate risk
interpretation.action: 2-day stroke risk ~4%; consider hospital admission for expedited workup

interpretation.label: High risk
interpretation.action: 2-day stroke risk ~8%; hospital admission recommended for urgent evaluation and treatment

citation: Johnston SC, Rothwell PM, et al. Validation and refinement of scores to predict very early stroke risk after transient ischaemic attack. Lancet. 2007;369(9558):283-292.

description: Estimates stroke risk in patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation to guide anticoagulation decisions.

options.label: Present
options.description: History of congestive heart failure or LV dysfunction (EF <= 40%)

options.label: Present
options.description: Resting BP > 140/90 mmHg on at least 2 occasions or current antihypertensive treatment

options.label: Yes
options.description: Age 75 years or older

options.label: Present
options.description: Fasting glucose > 125 mg/dL or treatment with oral hypoglycemic or insulin

options.label: Present
options.description: Prior stroke, TIA, or systemic thromboembolism

options.label: Present
options.description: Prior MI, peripheral artery disease, or aortic plaque

options.label: Yes
options.description: Age 65 to 74 years

options.label: Female
options.description: Female sex

interpretation.label: Low risk
interpretation.action: No anticoagulation therapy recommended (male); if female with no other risk factors, low risk

interpretation.label: Low-moderate risk

interpretation.label: Moderate-high risk

citation: Lip GY, Nieuwlaat R, et al. Refining clinical risk stratification for predicting stroke and thromboembolism in atrial fibrillation using a novel risk factor-based approach: the Euro Heart Survey on Atrial Fibrillation. Chest. 2010;137(2):263-272.

title: Patient Health Questionnaire-9
description: Self-administered screening tool for depression severity based on DSM criteria, frequently used in neurology for comorbid depression assessment.

components.name: Little interest or pleasure in doing things

options.label: Several days
options.description: Several days over the last 2 weeks

options.label: More than half the days
options.description: More than half the days over the last 2 weeks

options.label: Nearly every day
options.description: Nearly every day over the last 2 weeks

components.name: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Feeling tired or having little energy
Feeling bad about yourself, or that you are a failure, or have let yourself or your family down
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed, or being fidgety or restless
Thoughts that you would be better off dead, or of hurting yourself in some way

interpretation.label: Minimal depression
interpretation.action: Monitor; no treatment typically indicated

interpretation.label: Mild depression
interpretation.action: Watchful waiting; consider counseling or follow-up PHQ-9

interpretation.label: Moderate depression
interpretation.action: Consider pharmacotherapy and/or psychotherapy; treatment plan recommended

interpretation.label: Moderately severe depression
interpretation.action: Active treatment with pharmacotherapy and/or psychotherapy recommended

interpretation.label: Severe depression
interpretation.action: Immediate initiation of pharmacotherapy; consider referral to psychiatry; assess for suicidality

citation: Kroenke K, Spitzer RL, Williams JB. The PHQ-9: validity of a brief depression severity measure. J Gen Intern Med. 2001;16(9):606-613.

title: Epworth Sleepiness Scale
description: Subjective measure of daytime sleepiness assessing the likelihood of dozing in eight common daily situations.

options.label: Would never doze
options.description: No chance of dozing

components.name: Sitting inactive in a public place (e.g., theater or meeting)
As a passenger in a car for an hour without a break
Lying down to rest in the afternoon when circumstances permit
Sitting quietly after lunch without alcohol
In a car, while stopped for a few minutes in traffic

interpretation.label: Normal daytime sleepiness
interpretation.action: Unlikely pathological sleepiness

interpretation.label: Borderline sleepiness
interpretation.action: Consider further evaluation if clinical suspicion exists

interpretation.label: Excessive daytime sleepiness
interpretation.action: Further evaluation recommended; consider polysomnography or MSLT

interpretation.label: Severe excessive daytime sleepiness
interpretation.action: Urgent sleep medicine evaluation; polysomnography indicated; counsel on driving safety

citation: Johns MW. A new method for measuring daytime sleepiness: the Epworth Sleepiness Scale. Sleep. 1991;14(6):540-545.

title: Hunt and Hess Classification
description: Clinical grading scale for subarachnoid hemorrhage severity used to predict surgical risk and prognosis.

options.label: Grade 1
options.description: Asymptomatic or minimal headache and slight nuchal rigidity

options.label: Grade 2
options.description: Moderate to severe headache, nuchal rigidity, no neurological deficit other than cranial nerve palsy

options.label: Grade 3
options.description: Drowsy, confused, or mild focal neurological deficit

options.label: Grade 4
options.description: Stupor, moderate to severe hemiparesis, possible early decerebrate rigidity

options.label: Grade 5
options.description: Deep coma, decerebrate rigidity, moribund appearance

interpretation.label: Grade 1 - Low risk
interpretation.action: Good prognosis; surgical/endovascular treatment of aneurysm recommended

interpretation.label: Grade 2 - Low risk
interpretation.action: Good prognosis; early aneurysm treatment recommended

interpretation.label: Grade 3 - Moderate risk
interpretation.action: ICU admission; early aneurysm treatment; closely monitor for vasospasm

interpretation.label: Grade 4 - High risk
interpretation.action: ICU admission; stabilize before aneurysm treatment; high mortality risk; consider EVD if hydrocephalus present

interpretation.label: Grade 5 - Very high risk
interpretation.action: ICU admission; consider goals of care discussion; treatment individualized; very poor prognosis

citation: Hunt WE, Hess RM. Surgical risk as related to time of intervention in the repair of intracranial aneurysms. J Neurosurg. 1968;28(1):14-20.

options.label: No

options.label: No

options.label: Yes

interpretation.label: 30-day mortality ~13%
